author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: Community Growth DAO
description: O financiamento sustentável para os centros comunitários é necessário para o crescimento, porém o financiamento do Projeto Catalisador é normalmente apenas para projetos específicos.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal to form a community DAO fits within the community hubs scaling challenge, DAOs will enable Cardano community members to collaborate on shared project missions.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this proposal has been actively engaged in the Catalyst process, have plutus dapp developers on the team, and they include a well thought out project roadmap to delivering their DAO smart contract solution.
f6_assessments.q2: Given the in depth roadmap and the team behind this proposal its clear they have all the pieces required to have a successful implementation.

f6_assessments.q0: The Proposer seeks to create a DAO which will sustain community hubs for more awareness of Cardano and DAO net. Their main aim is to drive adoption and awareness of Cardano and DAO net by incentivizing members to join community DAOs to fund community projects. This is laudable for Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of two members have 20 years and 9 years of experience in software development, Community Advisor, and other stated  relevant skills to successfully implement the project. The plan is detailed in the proposal mentioning that there will be an operational funding for community growth, among others. The proposal can be implemented successfully, given all the facts in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is clear stating from February 2022 to July 2022 with detailed work schedule which is easily auditable. KPIs stated that they could measure the number of new members, number of community DAOs and number of community proposals funded. All these facts will make auditing easy to do.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to create a DAO that will fund other DAOs. Having a second oportunity for people to gain funding is definity a good idea. I find it in accordance with the challenge and if implemented, it can boost the cardano community, which will not be solely dependent on catalyst funding but there will be an alternative, which can encourage others.
f6_assessments.q1: The team bio is provided in detail and I find it suitable for implementing the goal. There is also a detailed roadmap with a budget that seems reasonably set. The risks are also considered and possible mitigations are stated. The only drawback is missing team member, which is also missing in the roadmap (team established), but considering other parts of the proposal, I do not find it too essential to decrease the score.
f6_assessments.q2: The problem solution is described in a clearly manner, and detailed KPIs with the roadmap are provided. The roadmap is set to 3 - 6 - 9 months, but the success definition is described for one year, which is increasing the possibility to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: Crypto (and Cardano more specifically) offers an exit strategy from the centralized legacy systems of the past towards a more community-driven and managed entities. These DAOs offer an exciting opportunity to engage more individuals by incentivizing their participation in communities and networks they are affiliated with, or hope to be affiliated with. While the DAO is generally a new concept in the public consciousness, creating a network of DAOs that are interlinked yet autonomous to achieve mutual and individual goals will be huge. The exciting part about this proposal is that it seeks to leverage the multitude of community DAOs being created and linking them through a community DAO that can be used to support different communities. This type of networking and capitalization on the minds of the masses is very exciting and likely would help drive mass adoption for the Cardano ecosystem, particularly for hard to reach or special interest groups.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the plan and experience provided it is extremely likely that this project would be implemented successfully. The reason why I feel voters can have extra confidence in the feasibility is due to the fact that the proposers are not simply creating a DAO for one project but instead are creating a broader community network where a collection of DAOs interact and collaborate towards our shared objectives. This means that when one DAO may be struggling or need assistance, they will be able to tap into the network effect for help. The proposers also demonstrate their ability to conduct such a project and provide links to back up their statements. It is also clear that the proposers are well versed in the space, having explicitly identified their key risks and provided comprehensive solutions for their resolution. As a community, Cardano is at the forefront of this type of collective thinking and action, I would love to see a project like this add that extra layer of connectivity to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, the proposal can easily be audited by the Cardano Community. The proposers are seeking to link the numerous DAOs across the ecosystem into a larger network, which will allow a variety of opportunities for community input and development. By capitalizing on the wisdom of crowds (individual DAO projects) the proposers are opening themselves to an iterative and constructive process. Moreover, the layout of the plan and it's milestones, KPIs are very measurable which could then be checked by the community. Finally, since the proposers explicitly state that they will open source this initiative for others who may want to follow a similar pattern. This means that any community members can take what is learned, apply it to their own context, and adapt it accordingly. Overall outstanding job and very exciting stuff.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies the problem for scaling up Cardano hub’s and clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. In my opinion the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges, with the goals aligning well with the challenge settings. The solution is unique and an excellent use of DAO infrastructure to drive Cardano adoption within the community
f6_assessments.q1:
After carefully considering the proposal, its interrelation to other/multiple proposals submitted and the proposers arguments for submitting multiple proposals, I am of the opinion that the submission of multiple project proposals creates confusion and uncertainty with the certain project achievable being reliant on the successful funding of other proposals submitted.
It is for this reason that a single project submission is preferred, but rather than requiring a large amount of funding from the beginning, the proposer should suggest funding release in stages based of the achievement of agreed project deliverables. In this manner the project would expand at a manageable rate as the lack of additional resource could result in delays if all aspects of project funded at once. But as mentioned the risk associated to one or more of the proposals not being funded and the potential impact on the overall project does not appear to have been adequately assessed, hence preference to single submission, as this also improves the auditability.

Risk & Challenges
Whilst a very necessary addition to any to any proposal, I feel the this segment to be poorly presented. The challenges / risks section reads more like a story and it is not immediately evident how the risk and impacts and controls correlate. It would be my recommendation, as business management system professional, to use a version of the following to assess risks. Using this may help to focus otherwise wordy explanations
(1)	description of the needs / expectations 
(2)	Clearly state Objectives 
(3)	Risk description
(4)	Assess the probability of the risk occurring by assessing 
a.	the likelihood. How likely is it that the risk will occur
(5)	Assess the consequence if the risk occurred against the following;
a.	Potential loss of customer or contract
b.	Potential inability to satisfy immediate job/task/order
c.	Potential Violation of regulations
d.	Impact on organisation reputation
e.	Est cost of correction/financial penalty
(6)	Controls – These are actions the prevent or reduce risk
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement has been provided and the metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal have been set out in quarterly segments. However this proposal fails to identify the metric/KPIs for marketing and advertising, making the auditability of this aspect difficult to complete.

solution: Criar um DAO que fornecerá financiamento contínuo do DAO Net aos Hubs Comunitários para impulsionar a adoção e conscientização do Cardano e do DAO Net.
experience: Uma equipe experiente de desenvolvedores Blockchain, pioneiros de Plutus, operadores de SPO, Conselheiros Comunitários e Analistas de Soluções.
